intro: Waltheria aspera, commonly known as the rough waltheria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
